710687f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street (West)
710687f-a.text:
General view of New York Central freight yards, Eleventh
Avenue, west side, from 4lat to 42nd Streets, showing
seventy carloads of Christmas trees for the holiday season.
About 1932.
Phetograph by Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712761f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 11th Avenue
712761f-a.text:
Vest 41st Street, east from a point to the east of Eleventh Avenue,
showing on both sides of this street, the new railroad bed for the
New York Central under construction. View No. 1 erphasizes Loewer's
Brevery (on the north side), while No. 2, the bottling plant and
St. Raphaels Roman Catholic Church (on the south sidel No. 3 is s
westward view of the buildings seen in No. 1. Note the statue affixed
to the front of the brewery.
Aug. 12, 1936
Views 1 and 2
View 31 May 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIANS.

August 12, 1936.

710692f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street (West)
710692f-a.text:
Eleventh Avenue, east side, from 42nd to 41st Streets.
March 29, 1935
P. L. Sperr, photographer

712762f-c.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 11th Avenue
712762f-c.text:
(1)
West 41st Street, south side, east from Eleventh Ave., and showirng
excavation for railroad tunnel. This segment will contain a by pass
affair that will connect the main tunnel, which runs parallel to Eleventh
Ave., with the 42nd Street yards and ferry.
December 4, 1936.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view into the excavation, and showing the diagonal cut-off from
the main tunnel. St. Raphael's R.C. Church appears east of Loewer's
Brewery.
August 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712762f-b.text:

712764f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 11th Avenue
712764f-a.text:
Figure of King Gambrinus, on Valentine Loewer's Gambrinus Brewery,
533 Wiest 41st Street, north side, east of Eleventh Avenue.
May 27, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712763f-a.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 11th Avenue
712763f-a.text:
(1) anc (2)
West 4lst Street, at the S.E. corner of Eleventh Avenue,
as viewed north westward from a point on 40th Street to the east
of the Avenue, showing the diagonal branch cut under Eleverth
Avenue, under construction. The Avenue appears thru the opening
with the 42nd Street area docks beyond. No. 2 of this set shows
details of preceding view.
May 1. 1936.
Views 1 and 2.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
T'he same, after demolition.
P. L. Sperr  September 4, 1940..
NO REPRODUCTIONS

710685f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street (West)
710685f-a.text:
Eleventh Avenue, west side, north from and including 41st
Street.
Pebruary 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, from a point a little farther north.
February 7, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same view as (1), three years later, but showing a little
of the east side. The buildings on the N.E. corner of 41st
Street have been demolished, and the space is now occupied
by a filling station.
March 20, 1935.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710696f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street
710696f-a.text:
Eleventh Avenue, east side, from 41kt to 43rd Streets, not showing
the N.E. corner of 40th Street.
March 20, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same at a later date, and showing the erection of a new 3-story
building (41st to 42nd Streets) for the International Truck Company.
August 12, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same at a later date and showing completion of the afore mentioned
building.
December 4, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

710679f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street (West)
710679f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave., at, adjoining and south of the S.E. corner of West 41st
Street. Also shown is West 41st Street, south side, east from Eleventh Av.
April 14, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

712761f-b.title: Manhattan: 41st Street (West) - 11th Avenue
712761f-b.text:
Vest 41st Street, east from a point to the east of Eleventh Avenue,
showing on both sides of this street, the new railroad bed for the
New York Central under construction. View No. 1 erphasizes Loewer's
Brevery (on the north side), while No. 2, the bottling plant and
St. Raphaels Roman Catholic Church (on the south sidel No. 3 is s
westward view of the buildings seen in No. 1. Note the statue affixed
to the front of the brewery.
Aug. 12, 1936
Views 1 and 2
View 31 May 1, 1936.
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIANS.

710688f-a.title: Manhattan: 11th Avenue - 41st Street
710688f-a.text:
Eleventh Ave., east side, north from West 41st to 42nd Streets. Build-
ing shown, has just been completed and will house the International Truckt Co.
December 5, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
